page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: We have been out to survey the dwellings in the area and we have discovered that almost half of those in the area are council owned, semi_detatched houses. There are four old peoples dwellings, approximately fifteen detatched houses or cottages and there are eleven farm houses. The majority of the houses are made from brick, seven of the cottages are stone built and there are six timber houses. There is very little new building, only two new houses have been built in the past year and very few others since the group of council properties which were built in the late 1940's. The farm buildings in the area and the few stone cottages are the oldest building. There still remain a few tied cottages.
